    • Uses of CityResources in model.event

      Methods in model.event with parameters of type CityResources 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Event> RiotEvent.applyEffects(CityResources resources)
      Gets more or less building rioting depending on the current happiness and saves a message according to it
      java.util.List<Event> NothingEvent.applyEffects(CityResources resources)
      Apply no effects.
      java.util.List<Event> MeteorEvent.applyEffects(CityResources resources)
      chooses a random tile and destroys it if it is a buildable tile, does nothing if it is not .
      java.util.List<Event> LuckyYouEvent.applyEffects(CityResources resources)
      Gives 100 $.
      abstract java.util.List<Event> Event.applyEffects(CityResources resources)
      Applies the effects of this event.

    • Uses of CityResources in model.tiles

      Methods in model.tiles with parameters of type CityResources 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void WaterPlantTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      removes the building it is applied upon and changes the city resources given the change
      void ResidentialTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      remove the selected residential zone tile and changes the resources given the tile chosen
      void PublicGardenTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      Removes the selected tile from the gameboard and updates the number of gardens
      void PowerPlantTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      remove the selected power plant from the map and changes resources upon the change.
      void PolicestationTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      removes the selected police station from the gameboard and updates the city resources given the change
      void IndustrialTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      removes the selected building from the map and changes the city resources given the building
      void HospitalTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      removes the building from the gameboard and updates the resources consequently
      void Destroyable.disassemble(CityResources res)
      Safely destroy the construction (for bulldozer).
      void CommercialTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      removes the selected building from the map and changes the city resources given the building
      void BuildableTile.disassemble(CityResources res)
      Sets the state of a given building to destroyed
      void ResidentialTile.evolve(CityResources res)
      build the selected residential zone and changes population capacity given the building built
      void PolicestationTile.evolve(CityResources res)
      evolve bring an under_construction building to a constructed one, it changes the resources consequently.
      void IndustrialTile.evolve(CityResources res)
      evolve takes a building from the under_construction state to the built state and updates the city resources given the change
      void HospitalTile.evolve(CityResources res)
      evolve takes an under_construction hospital and builds it (not used because hospital are never under_construction)
      void Evolvable.evolve(CityResources res)
      Evolve to a next state if needed resources are available.
      void CommercialTile.evolve(CityResources res)
      evolve takes a building from the under_construction state to the built state and updates the city resources given the change
      void BuildableTile.evolve(CityResources res)
      if a building is beside a road that is connected to the main resources (cityhall, waterplant and powerplant), then the building will evolve toward a "built" state and start producing what it is intended to produce.
      int CommercialTile.getConsumption(CityResources res)
      gives the amount of products to be consumed by the city bound to various factors such as the population amount, happiness, the number of workers in the shop.
      int ResidentialTile.getInhabitants(CityResources res) 
      int IndustrialTile.getProduction(CityResources res) 
      private int IndustrialTile.getWorkers(CityResources res) 
      private int CommercialTile.getWorkers(CityResources res) 
      void WaterTile.update(CityResources res)
      update doesn't do anything, since the watertile do not change with time
      void WaterPlantTile.update(CityResources res)
      while the building is standing up, update increases it's production each turn before reaching the maximum production
      abstract void Tile.update(CityResources res)
      Go to the next state.
      void ShoreTile.update(CityResources res)
      update does not do anything since shore tiles do not change upon time
      void RoadTile.update(CityResources res)
      update does not do anything since roads do not change with time
      void ResidentialTile.update(CityResources res)
      Update changes the state of the building if their are riot happening in the city and puts the building on riot mode so that it stops producing anything.
      void PublicGardenTile.update(CityResources res)
      updates give (each round) a fixed amount of happiness and a variable amount given the money spent on public garden maintenance
      void PowerPlantTile.update(CityResources res)
      while the building is standing up, update increases it's production each turn before reaching the maximum production
      void PolicestationTile.update(CityResources res)
      updates calculates the new Policestation capacity every turn depending on the budget spent on security
      void IndustrialTile.update(CityResources res)
      Update changes the state of the building if their are riot happening in the city and puts the building on riot mode so that it stops producing anything.
      void HospitalTile.update(CityResources res)
      updates calculates the new cell capacity every turn depending on the budget spent on security
      void GrassTile.update(CityResources res)
      updates does nothing because grass tiles do not change with time.
      void ForestTile.update(CityResources res)
      updates does nothing because forest tiles do not change with time.
      void CommercialTile.update(CityResources res)
      Update changes the state of the building if their are riot happening in the city and puts the building on riot mode so that it stops producing anything.
      void CityHall.update(CityResources res)
      Aside from enabling the network to work, the tile does not update
